Openly admits his lack of interest in chartered accountancy and the burden of societal expectations.

Feels pressure and responsibility on set, especially noticing the director's paranoia, which may indicate some self-doubt or stress.
Writes down the names of all the directors he wants to work with, showing goal-setting and clarity.
Receives a message from Raju Hirani and promptly boards a flight to Mumbai, demonstrating initiative and decisiveness.
Reasoned with his wife about the improbability of getting a film role without prior consideration, showing cautious and realistic thinking.
Decided to call Raju immediately after receiving a message, demonstrating decisiveness and confidence.
Offered to give Raju a screen test despite Raju's surprise, showing initiative and proactive behavior.
Grows fond of a puppy in the hostel, showing emotional attachment.
Expresses hesitation and takes time to confront his father about not pursuing engineering.
Relates deeply to his role and believes others will relate to it too, showing empathy and sincerity.
Communicates concerns about the script and collaborates with the director to improve character motivation.
Takes initiative to clarify his doubts about the script and suggests improvements, such as the trigger for confronting his father.
Waits patiently for two weeks without following up after initial contact, showing some passivity.
Proactively calls Raju to clarify shooting dates when he does not hear back, demonstrating responsibility and communication skills.
Relates deeply to the role and understands its significance, showing insight and emotional intelligence.
Shows a natural talent and interest in wildlife photography, indicating skill and passion in a specialized field.
Undergoes a significant personality transformation from a mild, innocent engineering student to a confident, rugged wildlife photographer, showing adaptability and growth.
Initially appears mild and innocent with a boyish look, which may suggest a lack of confidence or assertiveness in his early phase.
Politely accepted rejection after a poor audition and maintained composure.
Established a personal connection with Raju Rastogi by chatting when they met unexpectedly.
Was initially skeptical and honest about his lack of language skills.
Not weighed down by awe of shooting with a big star, performs without being hampered.
Skeptical about auditioning due to lack of language skills but still attempts it.
Terrible at first audition, corrected quickly and asked to stop, but remains polite and accepts failure.
Establishes a personal connection with Raju Rastogi during a chance meeting.
Receives a second chance and adapts to new audition requirements, showing flexibility and willingness to learn.
Adapts his audition performance creatively by doing gestures not in sync with his lines, impressing the team.
Uses limited Hindi knowledge strategically by sprinkling bad words to enhance his audition.
Recognizes his own limitations regarding language skills and doubts his suitability for the role.
Studies the text seriously and prepares for both comedy and drama scenes for the second audition.
Gives up another role to attend the important audition, showing prioritization and commitment.
Waits anxiously and does not follow up after long periods without calls from the team.
Accepts constructive criticism from Raju about his performance and adapts by stopping learning Hindi to better fit the character.
Expresses doubts and worries about giving up six months and low pay but ultimately makes a conscious, informed choice to pursue work that offers new and exciting challenges.
Focuses narrowly on his own character (Chatur) without initially understanding the full scope of the film.
Acknowledges language barriers that limit his understanding of the film and some scenes.
Isolates himself for three days to authentically perform an angry and depressed scene, showing dedication and respect for his craft.
Chats and mixes around with drivers and kitchen staff, showing openness and friendliness towards people regardless of social status.
